page.title: 12Society of Brothers
page.content: Darvell Hall is the British home of the Hutterian Society of Brothers.Their religion is Christian and their life-style is communal.The population is roughly 200,of whom 91 are of school age or below.The philosophy of the Society is based on the family,but with a strong emphasis on communal living.Education,up to the age of 13,takes place within the Society;after which age the children attend the local secondary school.Funds are raised chiefly through the manufacture of wooden toys made from imported maple wood.They also make equipment for the handicapped.This is the only section of the Brotherhood in Great Britain,although they have other communities,particularly in the U.S.A. and Canada,including a farm of 80,000 acres.
